newsitem.title: USA: NAFTA ministers praise Mexican financial progress.
newsitem.headline: NAFTA ministers praise Mexican financial progress.

text.p: The finance ministers of the United States, Canada and Mexico on Monday welcomed Mexico's progress to restore financial stability and economic growth, the U.S. Treasury Department said.
The treasury said the ministers met here on Monday as the North American Financial Group.

It said "They (the ministers) welcomed in particular the progress that Mexico has achieved in restoring financial stability and resuming economic growth, and their successful return to the international capital markets, which they agreed provided evidence of growing confidence in Mexico's economic policies."

The group was set up in the spring of 1994 to provide a way for the three countries of the North American Free Trade Agreement to meet regularly to discuss economic and financial policies as economic integration increased in the region.
